content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia code to solve your problem:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[ -]" => "_")
end
```

This function takes a string `col` as input, converts it to lower case using the `lowercase` function, removes leading and trailing white spaces with `strip`, replaces all spaces and hyphens with underscores using regular expression (`r"[ -]"`) and finally returns the cleaned column name.
